title: Staff Program Manager, Offsites & Gathering - Tech

pay_input_ranges.title: Pay Range
pay_input_ranges.blurb:
How We'll Take Care of You:

Our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as: training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role may also be eligible for bonus, equity, benefits, and Employee Travel Credits.

content:
Airbnb was born in 2007 when two Hosts welcomed three guests to their San Francisco home, and has since grown to over 4 million Hosts who have welcomed more than 1 billion guest arrivals in almost every country across the globe. Every day, Hosts offer unique stays and experiences that make it possible for guests to connect with communities in a more authentic way.The Team You Will Join
Airbnb’s mission is to create a world where people can Belong Anywhere. As we work to achieve that mission, we’re building world-class leadership experiences targeting our technical teams and leaders. We’re looking for exceptional and creative individuals inspired to deliver innovative learning experiences that have tremendous organizational impact. 
About the Role
The Staff Program Manager will play a key role in executing our Tech Leadership team offsites, events and forums. The person in this role will help design creative, engaging and impactful gatherings for our Tech team. Our leaders and teams gather several times a year, virtually and in person discussing and shaping vision, strategy and our roadmap. We aim to create experiences that build community and connection and invest in leadership skill development and capacity building. You will work closely with other members of the Tech L&D team to shape these experiences and may partner with other teams at Airbnb to execute these initiatives.
The ideal candidate is confident in their ability to blend project management, event coordination and planning with a deep understanding of how to facilitate and organize exceptional leadership programming. Key to success will be the ability to get into the details, to establish systems and processes, and to deliver world-class experiences with impact.
A Typical Day: 

Develop program strategy for various in person and virtual leadership offsites/events/forums collaborating with other Technical Learning & Development team members
Build a community and foster connection among senior leaders and senior individual contributors across the technical organization through development of in person and virtual leadership offsites/events/forums 
Own the project management, event planning and vendor management for both in person and virtual leadership offsites/events/forums 
Help create toolkits and guides to empower leaders to facilitate and operate their own events
Knowledge of a variety of activities and experiences to use in team building and offsite 
Design, create content and project manage leadership events for the Technology organization focusing on unique needs and business objectives
Drive change by project managing follow up activities after each event to ensure the organization and leaders act on commitments
Coordinate in-person and virtual logistics for learning and events
Measure, track and analyze the effectiveness of initiatives and programming using data to drive decisions
Build trusted relationships with senior business leaders across multiple groups and geographies
Partner with stakeholders, SMEs, senior leaders and external consultants 

Your Expertise

7+ years of experience guiding strategy and execution in an L&D or HR program/project management role
Experience designing leadership offsites for both small and  large audiences of 200+ leaders 
Track record of creative and best in class experience design
Demonstrated ability to manage several programs and initiatives at once, executing against a broad roadmap
Event management and planning experience, successfully  working with venues and vendors
Exceptional project management skills and detail orientation
Excellent facilitation and presentation skills, with an ability to adapt content and conversations to meet the target audience
Excellent interpersonal skills, including written and verbal communication skills
Demonstrated ability to build trusted relationships across a diverse range of stakeholders and cross-functional partners
Data-driven approach to evaluating and measuring learning experiences
Ability to proficiently use presentation technologies, google apps and spreadsheets 
Consultative and collaborative skills, comfort partnering with stakeholders, SMEs, senior leaders and external consultants
Strong understanding of Technology and Engineering organizations and how they operate

Your Location:
Due to the nature of this position, the successful applicant will need to be based in San Francisco, CA to be able to conduct their work. Currently, employees cannot be located in: Alaska, Indiana, Nebraska, North Dakota, Ohio, South Dakota, Wisconsin, Alabama, Mississippi, Oklahoma, Delaware And Rhode Island. This list is continuously being updated, please check back with us if the state you live in is on the exclusion list.  If your position is employed by another Airbnb entity, your recruiter will inform you what states you are eligible to work from. 
Our Commitment To Inclusion & Belonging:
Airbnb is committed to working with the broadest talent pool possible. We believe diverse ideas foster innovation and engagement, and allow us to attract creatively-led people, and to develop the best products, services and solutions. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.
We strive to also provide a disability inclusive application and interview process. If you are a candidate with a disability and require reasonable accommodation in order to submit an application, please contact us at: reasonableaccommodations@airbnb.com. Please include your full name, the role you’re applying for and the accommodation necessary to assist you with the recruiting process. 
We ask that you only reach out to us if you are a candidate whose disability prevents you from being able to complete our online application.How We'll Take Care of You:
Our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as: training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role may also be eligible for bonus, equity, benefits, and Employee Travel Credits.  Pay Range$155,000—$186,000 USD

questions.description:
Airbnb values diversity, inclusion & belonging for all, and is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. It's important to us that our workplace empowers people of all backgrounds, identities, and experiences to feel respected, valued and able to contribute at the highest level.

Self-identification is an important tool that provides an avenue for candidates to share their demographic information so that Airbnb can evaluate and implement strategies to build a culture that supports our community. As part of these efforts, we invite candidates to self-identify as to the categories below. Submitting this information is entirely voluntary and any information provided will be maintained confidentially and will not be used in making hiring decisions.
questions.label: U.S. Equal Opportunity Employment Information (Completion is voluntary)

values.label: I decline to answer the following questions.

questions.description:
Please identify your race.

Race & Ethnicity Definitions:

Hispanic or Latino: A person of Cuban, Mexican, Puerto Rican, South or Central American, or other Spanish culture or origin regardless of race.

White (Not Hispanic or Latino): A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Europe, the Middle East, or North Africa.

Black or African American (Not Hispanic or Latino): A person having origins in any of the black racial groups of Africa.

Asian (Not Hispanic or Latino): A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Far East, Southeast Asia, or the Indian Subcontinent including, for example, Cambodia, China, India, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Pakistan, the Philippine Islands, Thailand, and Vietnam.

Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander (Not Hispanic or Latino): A person having origins in any of the peoples of Hawaii, Guam, Samoa, or other Pacific Islands.

American Indian or Alaska Native (Not Hispanic or Latino): A person having origins in any of the original peoples of North and South America (including Central America) and who maintain tribal affiliation or community attachment.

Two or More Races (Not Hispanic or Latino): Persons who identify with two or more race categories named above.
